Junk! Slide in means WONT WORK. JUNK!! DO NOT BUY!!

I originally had a cheap Farberware air fryer. I loved it until the knob broke off and the whole thing stopped working. I knew I wanted another air fryer and one that could cook more food at once. I was unsure about ordering a brand that I wasn't familiar with, but I took a chance on it. It has been the best kitchen small appliance purchase I have ever made. I use this far more than my stove, oven or microwave. I'm thinking about getting rid of my toaster oven now because I very rarely use it.

Frozen foods are easily tossed in, a couple buttons are pushed, and then I walk away until it beeps. I can shake it if I want to, but that's usually not necessary. Gardein products and frozen french fries come out excellent.

Toss in some corn on the cob, spritz with a little oil spray, sprinkle on salt and pepper if you like, set it and wait until it beeps.

Toss in baby carrots, brussel sprouts, or other veggies, spritz with a little oil or veg broth, and you get delicious roasted vegetable.

Put down a little parchment paper, leaving some room for air flow, and bake cookie dough or biscuits from a tube.

Roasted chickpeas are terrific and really easy. The kids and I snack on them as is or I add them to wraps and salads.
Drain a can of chickpeas
Put the moist chickpeas in a bowl and season however you wish (we really like taco seasoning, nutritional yeast, or poultry seasoning and garlic salt). Be sure to shake them up to get seasoning on all of them.
Dump in air fryer and cook at 380 until crisp, shaking the basket once or twiice or not at all.
Super easy!

Roasted potatoes or french fries are also super simple. Just wash and cut your potatoes, toss in the air, spritz with a little oil or broth (I find oil spray works best), season, and cook.

If you are peeling potatoes for a recipe, toss the washed peels in the air fryer with salt and pepper for a tasty, crispy snack. I like to top mine with a vegan cheese sauce.

For things that are coated or battered, you will find that it doesn't do as well with a wet batter that will drip through the basket and stick, but there are accessories you can buy to get around that. Something more like a shake and bake coating works best. But you will want to work with your recipes. Sometimes, they are a bit dryer than baking or frying. I have successfully battered soy curls and seitan for chicken style strips, as well tofu.

Look up air fried tofu recipes. You will want to use an extra firm variety. It's a breeze! I've even done it as simply as marinating in barbecue sauce and then tossing in the fryer. A few minutes before it is done, you can toss in some chopped or sliced pineapple to go with it.

I bought some metal taco racks/stands that just so happen to fit perfectly in this fryer, so I've made bomb tacos.

I have also been successful at making taquitos in this, just be sure to heat your tortillas before rolling and put in the fryer seam-side down.

Vegan burgers and patties cook great in the fryer and you can add some vegan cheese and buns towards the end so the cheese melts and the bread toasts.

As for oil, I had envisioned an air fryer canceling out my use of oil entirely, but that didn't happen. Some foods just don't cook as well without it, such as potatoes. However, I have found that it only takes a small spritz, far less than I would use otherwise. Some foods can cook just as well with other types of moisture such as vegetable broth or even water. The chickpeas, for example, don't need any sort of oil. They are already moist from their own water, and they turn out perfectly.

Frozen waffles, frozen soft pretzels, crisping up something you have cooked in the microwave (baked potatoes for example) are all super convenient with an air fryer. It even brings leftover restaurant fries back from soggy to tasty!

Mine did suddenly stop working right before the warranty ran out. I contacted the company and they sent me a replacement with no hassles. I was so relieved because even a couple days without an air fryer has now become too many.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful customer service. Stand by the 1 year warranty.
reviews.reviewText: Last Feb we purchased this air fryer. We cooked breaded chicken thighs and without question, it was the tastiest, most succulent, perfectly crispy chicken we have ever eaten without the negative health effects of pan or deep fat frying. The preparation was easy and the timer was spot on for the finished product. We enjoyed this multiple times and had guests who also loved them. However, after 11 months, it stopped heating yet the digital display and fan were working. We contacted Simple Living. Michelle responded and requested we answer some questions and take a picture of the heating element. As soon as I provided that plus a short description of the problem she quickly responded and said they would replace the unit with a new one immediately. They weren't certain what the malfunction was as it wasn't obvious but just advised us to dispose of the unit rather than go through the efforts of returning it and waiting for a repair or a new one in exchange. We had several more email correspondence just about logistics of the sending the new one. All of my questions were answered well before I rechecked my email. She was so cordial, I never questioned her sincerity about her concern for us. We couldn't ask for better customer service....and chicken. Thanks, Michelle!

reviews.reviewTitle: The MVP of the kitchen! You will not be sorry!
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this air fryer for a little over a month & I'm really enjoying it! Especially during the summer when turning the oven on is unthinkable, this comes in and saves the day to make french fries to go with those cheeseburgers! This reheats food like a dream (i.e. egg rolls, breads etc) My husband and I even make our own tortilla chip using this air fryer and it comes out perfect every time, restaurant quality. The only item I want to add to the wish list for the next model is to make the temperature reach 425 degrees, otherwise this machine is awesome. It's so east to clean (hot tip: line underneath the removable basket with tin foil for super easy clean up! Customer service is amazing, I had an issue with my air fryer, Michelle & her team rectified it immediately and they were just so sweet! Just Buy it, I promise you won't regret it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality and even cooking can’t be beat !
reviews.reviewText:
I love everything about this air fryer! It’s easy to clean, use and the way it cookscid amaZing. It cooks evenly with no worrying if anything is being left undercooked where other parts or pieces are being overlooked or burnt because everything just comes out perfect.
Without hesitation I’d purchase this as a gift or just to have another if you entertained often and wanted another handy.
Best investment of a kitchen appliance to date . Couldn’t be happier . Honest review .

We had bought this air fryer earlier in 2018 hoping that it would simplify making meals and snacks in our household. Little did we know that we would fall in love with such an amazing kitchen tool! We have used our air fryer multiple times a day, everyday. We found out that we are able to make baked potatoes, to whole chickens, and our personal favorite, fries and chicken strips! It has a large basket, easy to use touch panel and has easy clean up. It surprisingly doesn’t take up a lot of room either. Not to mention, it’s a nice sleek design. After using it for quite a few months, our machine malfunctioned. I immediately sent an email to the company telling them about our sad news that the fryer was not functioning. I very quickly got an email back asking to send a video and a couple of photos so they can see what was wrong. I got a response and they said they would send us a new air fryer unit since it was covered under warranty. They were very pleasant to speak with! We got our new air fryer and life again is fantastic! We are so glad we have this tool in our kitchen. We can’t live without it and I would highly recommend getting one for your kitchen too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great air fryer! Try it, you’ll like it!
reviews.reviewText:
This air fryer is truly the ultimate in convenience! We’ve had it for a few months and I really wanted to know my thoughts before writing a review.

We have a family of 5, kids are young adults and this is big enough to accommodate our needs. The food is incredible. Anything you would fry, use this! But also we use it for hard boiled eggs, biscuits, and really anything we can think of. Everything had come out better than we expect and it’s super easy to clean. Definitely recommend this air fryer!

I recently upgraded my older and much smaller air fryer with this 5.8 qt air fryer and I'm in love! It's just my husband and me, but it's really nice to be able to cook enough food for both of us plus some leftovers in this HUGE basket! My favorite things to make are tortilla chips, frozen gyoza and roasted potatoes. You do need to use some oil spray (or toss your food in a drizzle of oil before cooking) in order to get the "fried" effect, but it's so much healthier than the alternative! I have yet to cook an entire chicken, but that is definitely in my near future! I second the comment in Jane's review about lining the lower basket with some foil before inserting the fry basket - makes clean up a breeze! I highly recommend this product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent customer service makes this the air fryer to buy!
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a birthday gift, and was so excited because even though I had asked for a different brand (only because I hadn't heard of this company) it looked like a perfect size. When I used it for the first time, I noticed the LED temperature display had some lights that weren't working properly so I decided to call customer service to see what could be done. How refreshing to speak to Michelle, who was efficient and kept me informed all along the way about a resolution. Though her engineers had never seen this issue before, they quickly diagnosed it and Michelle assured me that while the malfunctioning lights wouldn't impact functionality, she would feel better if she sent a replacement unit. When I asked whether I should package up the original unit, she said there was no need...she didn't want me to go through the hassle. So on top of the outstanding customer service, the unit itself is awesome. I've made apple fritters and bagels so far, and have a long list of other recipes to try! Oh- and the icing on the cake for me...Michelle told me they are a family-owned company, located just a few miles away from where I live. I love supporting local, family-owned businesses!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple Living AIr Fryer is Simply Fantastic!
reviews.reviewText: I'm so glad I decided to buy the Simple Living 5.2L Air Fryer. It has definitely changed the way I cook. What a pleasure it is to cook things like fries, onion rings, hamburger patties, chicken and anything I would have normally fried and not have to clean the stove top. Not only that but It is amazing how good the food is with little to no oil at all. My arteries have to be happy about that, Lol. My husband likes the way the food tastes so much that he wants me to make everything in it. I tried frozen corn cobbets last night and was really impressed with how fresh it tasted. Fried Okra is fantastic and my husband and granddaughter ask for it for a snack. Last night we were talking about needing another one so we can cook more things at the same time. Don't hesitate to buy the Simple Living Air Fryer, we couldn't be happier with it!

It is awesome! My deep fryer was going out, so I decided I wanted to replace it with an air fryer (which I then received as a birthday gift). The capacity is close to double that of my deep fryer basket, which means fewer "batches" to cook for my family of 5. I made frozen waffle fries, and they tasted like the "real deal" with very little oil. I was actually so excited to try it that I used the air fryer before the oil-mister I ordered came in. So, I put the fries in a bowl, drizzled oil & stirred. That was WAY too much oil for the air fryer, which just shows me how little oil is actually required. The fries were perfect, and I can't wait to try other things. I'm actually trying to think up excuses to "fry" foods!

This air fryer does NOT roast evenly. Pizza overcooks on top while remaining RAW on the bottom. Problem is that the inner pan sits so low in the drawer that there is virtually NO air circulation underneath. You cannot rotate pizza to crisp the crust without compromising the toppings! My older, smaller Philips required no turning or rotating the food because there is adequate space for airflow underneath. Also the Philips basket has an open weave pattern that further enhances air flow. I have hardly used the Simple Living but will donate it. Also it is absolutely Humongous!

I recently got the Simple Living 5.8qt Digital XL Air Fryer and it is definitely one of our favorite kitchen appliances! The recipes and different kinds of foods you can prepare are endless. I especially love the lack of oil added to foods while still having the "fried" taste! Very user friendly and is very sturdy. Cleanup is easy, too. Highly recommend this product!

reviews.reviewTitle: You'll eat so much healthier now!
reviews.reviewText:
At first, we tried fresh cut fries and had a little trouble with consistency, but realized that we didn't dry them off before putting them in. I'm not one to read instructions first :-) We've cooked individual pizzas meant for the microwave and they were to DIE for (a $.99 pizza never tasted so good!), we've cooked frozen breaded chicken patties and fish sticks in the air fryer with amazingly crispy results, and we've cooked crispy fried onions and perfected our french fries with NO OIL! Seriously, you'll eat so much healthier!
I did receive the item in exchange for my honest review, but what I've stated here was in no way affected by that. I love this thing and continue to find new foods to cook in it!

I won this air fryer in a contest a couple months ago and wanted to wait to review to make sure I had really gotten good use out of it for accuracy. And let me say...I love it! Our favorite use is making broccoli and cheese tots, crispier than the oven and zero oil. One thing I have found very desirable is it doesn’t put off much heat, so I have been using it more as summer has come to avoid turning on my oven. The only downfall I have found is that it’s so big it doesn’t fit in any of my cabinets for storage (would fit in the cabinet but won’t fit through the door), so it’s on my counter all the time. But honestly I don’t really care, it’s not an issue for us, but it could be if you have limited counter space and nowhere to store it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing customer service and a fantastic product!
reviews.reviewText:
When our Air Fryer arrived 3 days before the big game, we were super excited to try it and make all those fried treats for the Super Bowl. We were disappointed to find that the box had shipped without an instruction manual or the cookbook. I hopped on the Simple Living website and shot off an email. Within hours, I had a response from the company. They offered to not only mail a hard copy of the cookbook and manual, but to send a PDF of each so that we could use the fryer immediately. Absolutely fantastic response time and willingness to solve the minor issue.

As for the use of the fryer, it is very simple and easy to use. It took some experimentation on our part to get things cooked the way we liked, but that is in no way fault of the machine! It cooks evenly and completely. We've made cheese sticks, pot stickers, fried pickles, french fries, and even steak! Definitely recommend this fryer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Best purchase I have made for the kitchen!
reviews.reviewText: I use this air fryer almost daily! The size is wonderful for portions for my family, it is very high quality, precise cooking with the different cooking styles/options, and most of all it saves so much time in the kitchen! The cooking time is fast and the flavor is delicious no matter what you're cooking. It is much easier to use than I thought it would be and it takes almost no time to clean! The recipes that come with this are great as well! Highly recommend this air fryer over any others!

Ever since I started my weight loss journey, I wanted an easier wa to start cooking my foods. A more creative way! I got my air fryer and I haven’t used my oven since (okay, maybe once!) But definitely is so simple, quick, easy clean up, and QUIET! It heats my food to perfection! My favorite things to cook are salmon and air fry some vegetables! I would recommend to everyone to get this XL air fryer! So much space and the accessories come in handy if you’re making something in the pan or the rack!

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this product and use it almost every day.
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a Christmas gift and I've been using it just about everyday since then. I've made steak, fried chicken, fries, frittatas, veggies, pizza, salmon, buffalo wings, pretty much anything you can think of. Shortly after getting this airfryer I also started eating healthier and this product has helped tremendously by making thing quick and less of a hassle. Somedays I wish I had a second one.

Oh, how I love my air fryers! I had read on a FB page for air-fryer tips and recipes that people said you can't just have one - if you buy one, before you know it, you'll buy a second. So, I figured I'd get a digital and a manual. I did, and I'm glad. The price was right, and both are just wonderful. I always get sick when I'm at a restaurant and eat fried food - all that grease, sitting in the fryer and being reused upsets my stomach. But, I love the crisp, crunchy texture of fried foods. With this, I have the best of both worlds - foods cooked in air-fryers really are crispy - and they are healthier (no upset stomach, aftertaste, etc.) My favorite foods to prepare in an air-fryer are potato chips (took several tries until I perfected it), French fries, apple fries (breaded with graham cracker crumbs), roast chicken (unbelievable), steak (perfection), and I even baked a chocolate cake in mine! Yeah, I use it ALL.THE.TIME!

reviews.reviewTitle: Glad I got the large size!
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is great for my family of 6. I have made a 3 lb turkey breast, homemade chicken nuggets, fried zucchini spirals, and fried asparagus so far. I love how everything comes out crisp without all the oil and the air fryer is so easy to clean. Sone hot water and a little soap and it's done!

reviews.reviewTitle: Life Changing Way to Prepare Food!
reviews.reviewText: If you haven't used an air fryer, you're missing out. This fryer was a size upgrade from my last one, and it makes a big difference in how fast my food cooks. I just love this thing. I use it almost daily, making veggies, donuts, cakes, chips, you name it! It is quick to heat up, and doesn't make my kitchen hot like the oven. The size of this fryer is perfect, easily cooking enough veggies for 2-3 people. Great family owned company with solid customer service!

I paid $169 on Amazon, and now I will buy another air fryer, and I hope this one lasts longer. I would have given it 5 stars, until it died. But now, I can only manage 3 stars.
Had a problem with a part but it was replaced. The company was great in their replacement . The air fryer works without a flaw.

We bought our Simple Living air fryer in April 2018 and it quickly became our most used kitchen appliance, including it's use for reheating of yesterday's refrigerated restaurant leftovers or grocery store-bought frozen meals. Simply adjust the settings and walk away until the work is done! This fryer keeps on going and withstands the test of time. We have recommended this particular fryer to friends and family who have purchased it and enjoy it regularly.

reviews.reviewTitle: EASY to use and outstanding quality
reviews.reviewText: Use my Airfryer at least 4-5 times a week. It’s such an easy staple in my kitchen that allows me to make family favorites for so much fewer calories and fat (no oil)! It’s so so awesome! The temperature control is easy to use and the directions that come with it are super user friendly! Wouldn’t trade it for the world!

reviews.reviewTitle: Helped us stay cool this summer!
reviews.reviewText: We live in a mobile home, and try to not use the oven during the summer as it heats up our entire home. Having this air fryer has changed my life this summer! I didn't use my oven once, and even started storing our pots/pans in it! I am converted for life.

reviews.reviewTitle: I received this as a Christmas gift we have used ...
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a Christmas gift we have used it numerous times with all different types of food from boiled eggs, chicken, shrimp, steaks, cinnamon rolls, potatoes and so much more. We had an issue with the machine flashing an error message, turning off and it didn’t come back on. I reached out to simple living and they sent me a replacement machine. I have not had any other issues and we continue to use our machine frequently. I would buy this product and any other items from simple living due to their promptness in taking care of my previous issues.

Absolutely love my simpleliving airfryer. I’ve had a couple and this is the best one yet! Love how simple it is to use, clean up is a breeze and my food always turns out perfectly cooked. Such an awesome alternative to frying foods. Healthier too!

reviews.reviewTitle: sometimes a company like Phillips makes too many products (because they can) and ...

Hesitate to buy this product. It will not disappoint.

There is a slight learning curve at first as food cooks much faster than I'm used to with my convection oven. Take frozen chicken wings for example,
The instructions on the bag says preheat oven, spray lined baking sheet, spread wings evenly, cook for 28-33 minutes. With the Air Fryer I dump the whole bag (28 oz), set timer for 20 minutes, shake after 10 and they're ready to eat (but way too hot). I also cooked a Chateaubriand in it and it came out amazing!

reviews.reviewTitle: 5 qt units and thought I'd like more cooking room
reviews.reviewText: It's BIG! I'd looked at 3-3.5 qt units and thought I'd like more cooking room, well, this one if large. It throws quite a bit of heat so be sure and use it in an open place. I put it on my kitchen island on top of a cutting board and then I have room on the stovetop to set the basket when it's hot. It seems quite well made. The basket is a bit heavy, takes some practice to remove it when full. It's a learning curve. I think I'll be pleased. Tried fried chicken drumsticks and french fries the first day. Made a mistake of putting too much flour dredging on the chicken and the fan blew some out and the inside got a little messy. Chicken was very good, juicy and nicely browned. The fries were fine too. Seems important to check time, things got done sooner than I'd expected. There were no instructions for using the wire rack included, the divider for the basket is pretty self explanatory. I've ordered a recipe book that should help a lot.

We've since made french fries, chicken tenders, chicken parmesan, chicken fries, buffalo wings (oh my gosh! juicy meat and crispy skin without oil frying) and avocado fries. reviews.reviewTitle: If you cant cook, this will make you a superstar!
reviews.reviewText:
(Update 2) Im putting this back at 5 stars because of the unbelievable customer service. They sent me out a brand new replacement air fryer after a few questions about my broken unit. This was all in the span of one week. I cannot explain how much Ive missed using this product in that period, that most of what I eat is cooked in there. It's been a very long time since Ive seen such excellent customer service like this and wholeheartedly recommend this companies products to everyone!

(UPDATE) Im reducing this to 1 star because the fryer died almost 4 months to the day of receiving it. I was using this almost every night. Last night it popped the fuse in my wall socket. Reset the fuse and the fryer no longer gets hot. Outside the return and support window. Extremely upset. Good thing I have a microwave to fall back on. Probably worth it to spend more and get a quality unit next time.

It should be illegal for me to step into any kitchen. I cannot cook to save my life and if I tried I would probably kill someone. If it werent for the microwave I would probably be dead. I use my oven for storage and my dishwasher has been run 3 times in 10 years.

I was gifted a Breville oven many years ago and I probably use that as much as my microwave, but to reheat pizza of course.

I decided at the end of last year to start eating healthier and stop eating hot pockets....yeah I eat like a 12 year old. A friend of mine got an air fryer and she kept telling me how amazing it was and that I could use this and eat healthier. I got this on one of the special deals for $99 and figured that was a decent price to spend on something I might never use.

I cleaned off my counter and placed this next to my Breville. They seemed happy together and understood where each others place was in my eating life. They werent angry and there wasnt any fighting. Yeah, this thing has a big footprint too.

I didnt really have much in my freezer(my other favorite item in the kitchen) that I could make in this thing so I went out with a list when I went shopping. Unfortunately, that happens like once a month so it sat for a while before I got to try it.

First thing I tried were fried fish things(because I usually made them in the breville). They came out fantastic! Crispy on both sides and cooked all the way through. Half the time as the Breville with no flipping and no messy Pam sprayed foil.

Then I made cocktail hotdogs, you know, pigs in a blanket. WOW, these were flaky on the outside and cooked perfectly on the inside.

Next I tried crinkle cut fries. Burnt Fail! You cant rely on the cooking time in the instructions or on the bag of the fries. Second time I tried making these I burnt them again. Third time I made these I again burnt them. Im chalking it up to crappy fries.

Up next were wings, not just regular wings but BBQ wings. Another excellent cooking experience. Came out delicious.

Then I tried empanadas. These also came out great. Crispy and flaky on the outside, inside nice and hot and cooked. I liked very much.

Went back to the store and got different fries. This time it was waffle fries and they came out awesome the first time.

Im not going to go through everything else Ive tried but so far this fryer has been a life saver. Its probably one of the best things Ive ever bought myself.

Oh I should probably mention the cleaning. Its EASY! When they say "no stick" they mean it. After everything Ive made I just give it a quick rinse in the sink and a wipe with a paper towel. Everything is like new again. I did go through the initial directions of oiling it and heating it up before using, not sure if that helped but I like following directions. That being said, Ive never put any oil in this thing since and I feel healthier every time I use it. Ok, so maybe what Im actually cooking isnt healthy, but at least Im not adding to it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be prepared for some great tasting food

My wife has been asking for an air fryer for over a month, and since it was Christmas time, it seemed like a good time to get her one. I looked at a lot of air fryers before choosing this one. Some of the factors I used to pick this were:

3. Good price.

reviews.reviewTitle: but I'm glad it worked out this way
reviews.reviewText: Originally I ordered the 5L version, which is no longer available. It was received in defective, but I'm glad it worked out this way! Michelle was fast to take the defective unit back and work towards sending us the larger and nicer 5.2 when it was available! It warms up quickly and cleans up nicely. The recipe book is very basic, but perhaps that's what people need. The food comes out nicely, but not exactly like fried food.

I was skeptical when a friend told me that she uses hers almost everyday, but since my Doctor said no more fried foods, I decided to try it. First thing that I made was breaded chicken breast. They came out golden brown and crispy, just like fried and the meat was juicy. Then it was home made french fries, again golden brown. Next I did a whole chicken that was around 5 pounds. The recipe said 75 minutes at 390 degrees. After 45 minutes I checked it and the bird was starting to get a beautiful golden brown. At 60 minutes I checked again and it was starting to look like a rotisserie chicken. At 75 minutes, the machine turned off and I left it in there until everything else was ready. It was unbelievable, so juicy and golden brown with a crunchy skin. This item is going to get used nearly everyday. I'm doing pork chops today. I plan on getting a air fryer cookbook, so that I can make more healthy dishes. If you've thought about getting one, do it, you won't be sorry.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love my air fryer and not sure what could make it any better.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a very useful small convection oven
reviews.reviewText:
Up top there is an electric fan then below that a heating coil. The removable tray holds the basic no stick perforated basket that allows the air to flow throughout the cooking chamber. Various pans and racks can be placed in the basket to accommodate cooking whatever it is you are preparing. The advantages are faster cooking time as you are heating less space and moving the hot air around. It is also very easy to pull out the basket to check on your cooking progress and make adjustments. This is a pain with a normal oven, but super simple and convenient to do here. This little portable convection oven has huge advantages over conventional ovens. The term "air fryer" is not informative, so that is the why of this introduction.
The Simple Living 5.8 qt unit is quite satisfactory in all respects. It seems well made and is very functional. No negative issues at all, it is all good. Sure it is large, I had to make room in my pantry to put it away when not is use, but I do the same with my multi-cooker. The included rack and two pans are quality and useful. I am supplementing them with other containers I already have that easily work in the basket. My wok steamer basket and silicon strainer have been particularly useful. The unit does not overheat so I can clean it up and put it away immediately after use.
I did my first low and slow with a large chuck roast. I ground my seasonings, added olive oil, rubbed it onto the roast, set the temperature to 400 for 5 minutes to sear it and give it color. I then set the temperature to 180 for 4 one hour sessions. The meat come out perfect and there was virtually no drippings. Clean up took only 1 minute with hot water and a little Dawn.
In summary, I find this little convection oven to be very useful and will likely not use my conventional oven again. The Simple Living company has delivered a good product at what I perceive to be a good value. I recommend this product and this vendor.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... Mother's Day and we as a family have really enjoyed it. The meats we've cooked in it have ...
reviews.reviewText: I got this for Mother's Day and we as a family have really enjoyed it. The meats we've cooked in it have come out browned on the outside but still tender and juicy on the inside. Tater tots come out crispy. Really is what they claim! We are a family of four, so I wanted the big one. I cooked four hamburger in it at one time, and if I wanted I could put a whole chicken in there I could. So happy with the size. Read the instructions! Even though the basket and other things are non-stick, they suggest curing it with coconut oil and if you want to spray it before cooking, don't use aerosol spray. I bought a spray bottle and filled with oil. Happy cooking!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for reheating and frozen foods.
reviews.reviewText: We have had this for a couple months now. We mostly use it to reheat fried foods, cook french fries or other breaded frozen foods. I have done a few other things in it such as steaks. There is definitely a learning curve. You need to check things often as the cookbook times are off. For the size, it doesnt seem to cook much food. I find that I dont use it as often as I would like because I cant fit enough in it for a family of 4. I like it for the frozen and fried food reheating. Those types of things come out much better than if they were cooked in oven or microwave. However, not sure I would get it if I had to make the choice over again. Just not enough versatility to justify price and size.

Having never owned an air fryer before, it was with some trepidation that I ordered one. Now that it's here, I could not be happier. The gold standard for any kind of fryer is: how well does it do french fries? Without a doubt, the Simple Living Digital XL Air Fryer excels. French fries come out golden brown, crunch on the outside and soft on the inside. Just like a grease fryer without the grease! I have also, so far, cooked breaded shrimp which also came out perfect.

This model is big. But there is plenty of room in the fryer to cook enough food for 4 without any problems. The control on front is very easy and simple to use. There are presets for a number of different types of food to cook. You may find they work just right for you or, like me, they need a slight variance to get that just-right doneness.

One feature that I particularly like: When I take the basket out in the middle of cooking to give it a shake, I can put the basket back in and the fryer starts up from where it left off. No buttons to push or settings to make. Very nice! Oh, and one other thing...When it finishes cooking the fryer automatically turns off. No worries about extra, extra crispy french fries!

Lastly, the device is light, relatively quiet, and emanates very little cooking smell (compared to grease fryers).

Overall, if your counter space is very limited, then I would suggest a smaller mode. Otherwise, you would not make a mistake by buying this model.

Love it.

We are still learning.

Worked:
Chicken wings. Used chicken preset. 6 minutes on each side. Delicious.

Crinkle cut frozen fries.
Preset and shook halway.
Delicious

Frozen breaded calamari.
350
Was ok.
Not sure if we should have left in a little longer. ..or went to 375.

Frozen breaded mushrooms
Sucked.
350 for about 12 minutes.
Thinking of trying 375 and longer time.

Scrambled eggs
Delicious
2 eggs
3.5 minutes at 300.

That's it for now.

This thing is big enough to feed a family. Large capacity and easy to clean when done.
It just looks great, not too noisy
Very easy to use. I was able to crispy chicken wings the first day!

I would suggest that you start off small and get the hang of the cooking time and temps. Once you have it dialed down you will see that your Kung Fu is strong when using this device.

Would I recommend? I already have! my brother is getting one !

The digital settings aren’t easy - I have to start mine before I can change the temp or time. Mine lasted 11 months, then started smoking while cooking bratwurst, cut off and wouldn’t restart. I used this 2 - 3 times per week for anything from bacon to turkey breast.

Big fan of this air fryer. I love to cook veggies and frozen meats in this (think turkey hamburger patties, frozen fish, chicken nuggets, etc). I like that it comes with the cooking accessory pans. Everything comes out yummy, and it's easy to use and clean. It's a little bulky, but it doesn't bother me. I mostly set my own settings for heat and time - I don't use the auto modes much. If i get tired of looking at it (I hate cluttered counters), I just stick it in the pantry until I'm ready to use it again.

Once I cooked in this air fryer 2-3 times I was totally satisfied. I now have the confidence to try more categories besides French fries, and other easier foods. I have cooked a small pork roast and was very satisfied with the results. I am now choosing the air fryer before my toaster oven and large stove oven. Cornish game hens were beautiful and very tasty. Easy clean up is a 10 star plus. Why would I use my other 2 ovens for just my husband and I? I am soon to roast a chicken, and know that the results will be as successful. Very happy I purchased this air fryer.

This air fryer is amazing!! From the outside it seems like it is the same size as my last one, but it fits so much more food! It’s easy to cook with, cooks evenly and quickly, and makes the most delicious meals! It is a bit large to keep on the counter if it’s not being used, but it’s easy to take in and out of the cupboard at meal times! I love the accessories that came with the kit, the basket, pan, and wire rack make cooking multiple items so much easier! Love this product and definitely recommend it!!

We are so glad that we got this. We had been on the fence about buying one for about a year when a relative told us how much he enjoyed his. We have made zucchini fries, pizza, mini perogies & pigs in a blanket; they all came out good. The instructions for this machine could have been a bit better (took me a minute or two to figure out there was a button to push to get the basket out) as to how to use but thanks to a 5 minute YouTube video we were up and running quickly. We can cook food in about 1/2 the time of a regular oven without giving up crispiness.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Purchase for a Fantastic Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is the BEST. It is very easy to use and clean. I’m really not a cook but using this air fryer is fun and everything I’ve cooked so far has been delicious. The size and preset cooking functions are great. My husband has started using the air fryer to make sandwiches and heating up leftovers. We very seldom ate fried foods but now it’s this air fryer we can and know that we are not getting all the unhealthy fat associated with fried food. This is the best purchase I’ve made lately.

Bought this for my wife as a Christmas present. It arrived in just a couple of days.
I followed directions for seasoning basket and just beware that the first use while seasoning it will smell really bad. Might be a good idea to do it outside the first time.
We follow directions and made fried chicken thighs. Set the temp to 380° and set the timer to 22 minutes, flipped the chicken half way through the cook time and the chicken came out golden brown and juicy. The skin was crispy and tasted like it was deep fried without all the mess.
So far this is the only thing we have cooked but it turned out very good.

reviews.reviewTitle: works as advertised. I am not sure that one brand is better than the other.
reviews.reviewText:
Works as advertised.
I am not sure whether one brand is better than the other.
I bought their 3 qt version also, which is more compact for daily use.
This 5 litre version is very large..

reviews.reviewTitle: So glad I finally got one!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this air fryer. I had been debating on getting one for a while and am so glad that I finally went through with it. It is easy to use and has a large capacity. I easily can make French fries for the whole family. Also it works great for reheating certain types of food. Namely fried foods... I used to always throw away leftover fried foods but not anymore! I just use my air fryer and they are as good as new and sometimes better! Great purchase!

I was a little skeptical at first, but now that we’ve been using our air fryer for the past 7 months I’m a believer! I even talked my mom into getting one. We had a countertop convection oven and this takes the place and does the job so much better and quicker. I’ve cooked steaks...amazing, frozen burgers and fries (together)...awesome and quick, fried chicken...perfect, and cooked and reheated numerous foods...everything always turns out great. I would caution to not leave foods sitting in here after it’s done as something crispy can turn soggy with the steam. We don’t even have a microwave anymore, this can do it all and keep your foods crispy.

The size of this is a bit large, be sure to measure. It’s no louder than most microwaves. The preset options are nice for various meats and foods so you don’t have to guess or look things up ever time.

I really like this air fryer. The first thing I made was fresh French fries. I've done breaded chicken, salmon, rolls and so many things in it. It's quick and easy and clean up is a breeze. I'm very happy with my purchase. Pictures are breaded zucchini and a small egg frittata.

I have used it 2 times and am still getting used to it. It is REALLY big, so plan where you will put it and look at the dimensions. Kinda clunky. But having said that, it air fried potatoes, green peppers and onions and did it without too much grease. Flavor was great and the results were better than pan fried. Not sure what else I will use it for.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this. It does what is say it do
reviews.reviewText:
I love this. It does what they said it will do. I was scare but it work well. I did french fries and chicken wings. I want to try a whole chicken next.

Update:
Breaded Fish and Mango Salsa made in Simple Living Products 5.8qt Digital XL Air Fryer.
The outside was crispy and the inside was moist, well cooked and not dry like when it is cooked in an oven. It was so good with the Homemade Mango Salsa.
I love this air fryer.

reviews.reviewTitle: You Can Cook Lots of Things in This AIr Fryer
reviews.reviewText: I was excited to get this air fryer about 1-1/2 months ago. It took me about two weeks to use it because I kept forgetting to get some of the items to use from the recipes. It's a very nice sized machine and you'll be able to cook lots of things in it. So far ... I've cooked a few breakfast quiches, a whole chicken, and fried chicken drumsticks a few times. I didn't give it five stars because I still need to try some additional recipes, but you won't be disappointed!

This is a lot bigger than I expected, but in the long run, I'm glad. This 5.8 Qt Digital XL air fryer is large enough to prepare our meal without cooking in shifts. It lives on a shelf in the garage (right next to my 8 qt Instant Pot!) when not in use, but it is easy to bring in and set up when I need it. It works great. Easy to use and easy to clean. My husband liked - no loved - the crispy French fries.

This was on sale, so we decided to try it. Made some french fries with it right away and they turned out amazing. We now use this all of the time. Great product. Only wish it had a better separation rack, the one included is too porous, or rather is just a few strands of metal and can't really hold up much above it to let the air through. Actual function and results are great with this thing.

We had been using a smaller air fryer, by a different manufacturer, but needed a larger one, so we tried the Simple Living large fryer. We liked how it cooked, but after a few uses, it started to rattle, and within a couple of months, it died completely. I contacted Simple Living and was pleasantly surprised by their immediate and personal responses. They asked me to check certain functions, and then to send them a video showing them the problem. Once I finally figured out how to edit a video so that it was not too large to upload and send via email, they responded quickly, and within a few days they sent me a new fryer. I would buy from this company again.

I read a lot of reviews about the coating peeling. I've made sure to treat the coated items as instructed. Actually, treat them every 3rd use. We only use plastic or wooden spoons, spatulas etc with them. So no peeling after a month. I also think the treating us helping everything from changing shape. Item cooks as expected, better actually. My only complaint is the handle gets really hot. So be warned a mitt is needed. I'll update after another couple of months.

I received my 5L Air Fryer about a week ago, and so far, I absolutely love it! The basket and pan clean up super easy!!! I can usually just use a paper towel and wipe the pan clean.

The recipe book that came with this unit is really nice quality with color photos, but there are only 9 recipes. I am having to learn how to alter my recipes so they work well in this unit, but I have had a number of successes with it. The first thing I made in it was some thin fries. We made 3 lbs., divided into 2 batches, and 3 of us ate every one of them! They were really good! I have also baked homemade biscuits (7-8 min. at 400, brush with butter and turn halfway through), baked chicken drumsticks, 20 minutes at 370 (spray with oil and turn halfway through), onion rings, breaded mushrooms, and my favorite, BBQ seasoned potato chunks, 15 minutes at 370 (shake halfway through).

I had really struggled with which brand and model of air fryer to purchase, but since I am often cooking for family or other guests, I decided I wanted a large one. The XL Philips brand was $300, this one was $170! So far, I am very happy with my decision.

I have a small family and often I fix a meal for one. The accessories that come with this product makes it perfect. I'm able to stack a meal some times or put a piece of chicken in the oven and leave it cooking while getting ready for work. Then once I'm about ready to walk out the door, I transfer my meal to a container and go. I have had several ovens different companies and all were too big and cumbersome to clean. However due to the accessories, I can clean everything in a jiffy. I would recommend this oven to a friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: WONDERFUL! And on this unit capacity is very good ...
reviews.reviewText:
This is the BOMB for "frying" ? "baking"? almost anything! Fries, fish, chicken, okra, even things with "heavy" breading (so it doesn't drip off) we carry this in our coach because food can be prepared inside or out without generating a bunch of ambient heat! WONDERFUL!
And on this unit capacity is very good enough for a dinner party of reasonable size, and clean up is a piece of cake!

We couldn't be happier with the air fryer since we got it on Prime Day. The deal was amazing and the results are even better. We've done food several times every day sic e we got it for our 3 year old. French toast sticks, corn dogs, chicken nuggets, mozzarella sticks, hash browns and French fries. All came out perfect. On top of that, it throws off very little heat and saves the kitchen from heating up by using the oven in the summertime. Would recommend to anyone with a family. Large basket makes plenty of food.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very large, if you have limited counterspace.
reviews.reviewText: First off, it is very large to have sitting out on your counter, so keep that in mind when purchasing. Other than the large overall size of the fryer, I LOVE IT! It is very easy to use, it cooks food that tastes fantastic without all of the butter/oil that you would normally use. I like the fact that you can open it up at any time while cooking to check on food and the timer starts right back up where you left off when you close it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to use Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: I am fairly new to air fryers and the first one I bought from a different company was unusable by month 4 with an electrical error and I was not at all satisfied with the customer service of the company so I decided to try a new air fryer. I LOVE this air fryer and prefer it over my first one. This one is so easy to use and to change the digital settings. I also am very happy with the customer service I have already received from this company so highly recommend this product and Simple Living.

We love our air fryer. My 22 year old son probably uses it more than any of us. When he moves out I’m sure I will buy him an air fryer to take with him. Clean up is so easy and it is super easy to use.

One of those appliances that changes the game. Change, as in "put in 2 large frozen chicken breasts and 20 minutes later have delicious fried chicken". Just got it a week ago for Christmas but every day we're finding more and more way that this air fryer is making life easier cooking for 5.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cooks Great, Product Quality is Flawed
reviews.reviewText: I Love my Air fryer for how it cooks the food, My Issue is the Quality of the Material and the design. The basket has to be aligned just perfectly when opening and closing to check the food. It can take numerous tries to get the alignment right. The Basket handle plunger broke after only 3 uses and now I can't separate the basket from the drawer. This is a serious issue for trying to clean the two. I now have to find a replacement for the two which I am sure is going to be costly if at all available.

Was so excited to get but a tad nervous to cook with. Nothing to be scared about.... easy to use, clean and made some great healthy meals thus far. Brussel sprouts, mini potatoes, sweet potato fries, steak, chicken and salmon have all be fabulous thus far!!!! Can’t wait to try more!

I love my air fryer. Dieting makes you crave fried things. Now I can have air fried sweet potatoes or roasted veggies anytime without heating up the kitchen. It’s great for steaks, pork chops and fish fillets too.

I've only used this Air Fryer on three occasions since purchased. The first two times were chicken wings and the results were great Most recently, I tried a five pound chicken with excellent results.
I would highly recommend.
Works well. Wish there was a better recipe book for it and basket a little cumbersome taking out to shake but it cooks great
Awesome product if you don’t have one your are missing out ,very convenient and easy to use makes super good fries and baked potatoes just 2 of my favorites!

I can honestly say this is one of the best purchases that I have made. I use it every morning and most evenings. We eat more vegetables now than we ever have. I can make anything in this fryer. If you can bake, roast or fry it... you can make it in the fryer. It is so easy, clean up is a breeze. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very satisfied with this air fryer!
reviews.reviewText: Nice size for a family of four or more! Have been using it daily since it arrived a few weeks ago. It is my first fryer! We searched other brands and sizes but narrowed it down to this one because it was bigger, digital, and had favorable reviews. Looking forward to trying new things in this.
I purchased this as a gift for my husband and now it is literally the only thing that he uses to cook with. The food comes out just as good, only healthier!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy and quick for kids to use. Food turns out great and crunchy
reviews.reviewText: LOVE !! This product. My kids use it every day. Have had friends buy it because we like it so much! We take it in the rv with us for easy and quick meals. Breaded Food turns out crunchy like frying it without the grease. Also “Try bacon in there.” Had to call the company for a warranty issue and they were incredible to deal with sent me a whole new device the same day!!

Love my new air fryer! Choose this one because of all the positive reviews and the great testimonies on costumer service. I have used it almost everyday since receiving it and food comes out just as wonderful as I was hoping and clean up is a breeze! On the down side, Digital touch buttons don’t always respond right away and I have to push again or start over. And I’ve tried multiple times to register it online and site won’t respond to submit click.

I absolutely love my simple living products 5.8qt xl airfryer! This is by far the most used appliance in my kitchen. Any frozen convenience food such as chicken nuggets or fries crisps up perfectly! I also love cooking seafood especially salmon in my airfryer! It stays moist inside but crisp outside! You will love the airfryer if you decide to purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: This product is a good buy. I was skeptical about buying an air ...
reviews.reviewText: This product is a good buy. I was skeptical about buying an air fryer. I spent weeks researching the best one to buy. I ended taking a risk and going with this one. I am not regretting it. It's not complex or hard to use. It's huge which I love love love. I love this buy. Worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: No oil, no mess! So easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: Was a skeptic but purchased because my husband seemed excited to try this. Made my famous fried chicken strips and they were pretty amazing, more crunch than I thought. Easy cleanup for store with no oil or mess. Next I did Panko Crumbs on fresh rockfish and it was absolutely delicious. Go for it you won’t be sorry. We bought the larger unit since my husband likes to eat 😀

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the room of the larger fryer
reviews.reviewText: Love ❤️ this air fryer. It arrived on time and the packaging was great. I’m have used this on everything from chicken, egg dishes, brownies and the list goes on and on. I enjoy the large size of the pan. I purchased many of the accessories to with the air fryer. It is great and I don’t have to use much oil. I would recommend this item to anyone.

Have owned this several months now, it is great for cooking a whole chicken in under an hour, cooks perfectly. Good for pork chops, chicken wings, fish. Cleans easily, it's a good product, get rid of the deep fryer.

Love it. Easy to use and ease of cleanup and better than baking. It took me awhile to tak myself into it. But I have talked to several people who raved about it . So I thought that I would give it a try. I am Glad I did because I love it.

I am beyond content with this air fryer!!! My family and I opened it on the day it was delivered, and have been using it ever since. It's quick, easy to use, convenient, and we all love it. Very satisfied with my purchase, may even gift one to my daughter as her wedding gift!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works Great, but its REALLY LARGE and takes up a LOT of space
reviews.reviewText: Works as described, is easy to clean and food tastes great. Biggest drawback is that it is really LARGE and takes up a lot of space. Not really something that I'll use everyday so its a bit of a challenge to store it and then pull it out for a small batch of fries....

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE this. I bought it for our super bowl ...
reviews.reviewText:
LOVE this. I bought it for our super bowl party this year and made my wings in it. That were the best wings I ever made. They were crispy outside and tender inside. I never got results like this with my deep fryer or in the oven no matter what I tried. The lack of oil is just another bene.

When I dropped my fryer and broke the basket I contacted to company to help me with a replacement. They called me back in minutes!! My replacement part is in the way. Great customer service. Heartily recommend this product.
Easy to use, easy to clean, cooks food quickly. It's much faster and cooks better than my oven or toaster oven for hash browns, french fries, pork chops, even eggs, and reheating fried leftovers.

Love this air fryer! Very easy to use and clean. Food cooks evenly and quickly. Breaded items are nice and crispy.
I would like to know if there is a grill pan that is comparable with the Simple Living XL 5.8 qt.
Excellent product.

Love, love my air fryer! I use it to make potato fries, cook chicken, fish and roasted brocolli. I even use it to reheat pizza slices for a crispy crust and toast sandwiches. It's easy to use and convenient.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes cooking anything faster and better tasting!
reviews.reviewText: For the money, you can say it's high priced however the durability of this product and the ease in how to clean it! The amazing speed that it can cook food and yet taste so good is unquestionable! I would recommend this to everyone.

Wasn't sure I would "love" it but I do. We use it all the time -mostly for side dishes. Easy to follow user direction/recipes.
Pretty straightforward operation. Glad we ordered the XL Fryer as it accommodates large quantities without fuss. I have recommended it to friends/family.
Fantastic product. Well made, sturdy, easy to use instructions.

reviews.reviewTitle: We really like this - it works as advertised
reviews.reviewText:
We really like this - it works as advertised. We have tried homemade fries and chicken wings - straight from frozen raw chicken wings. And both have turned out very well.
The only downside is it can be hard to clean, particularly after wings. Cleans okay if you leave it to soak overnight, but the non-stick is not very non-stick.
This Air fryer is very quiet, easy to clean, and does what is advertised. I particularly like the 2 pans and rack that come with it.
I bought this for my daughter, and she loves it. She uses it almost every night.
I purchased this as a gift for my son-in-law who enjoys cooking. He loves it! My daughter reports that he uses it daily and the food is delicious!

reviews.reviewTitle: but so far it has been great. I think I am going to love it
reviews.reviewText: I have not used it on a lot of things yet, but so far it has been great. I think I am going to love it. It is big enough to cook many things, I do not think I would like a smaller version as much as this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far so good! Food cooks faster and is crunchier than in ...
reviews.reviewText: So far so good! Food cooks faster and is crunchier than in the oven. Hashbrowns for breakfast were awesome. Very crunchy with just a spray of oil. Clean up is very easy. Has a little bit of a plastic smell but, it is new and gets better each time we use it.

Great customer service. Ours quite working and after some trouble shooting they sent us a brand new one. I love the large basket, the controls are easy to use and our kids love to cook their snack foods in it.

I’ve been using my air fryer for just about anything that should be cooked in it. I can’t believe it took me so long to purchase one. It’s simple to use and easy to clean. My scallops didn’t come out good but that was my fault.
Works great, chicken wings came out crispy and well done the way I like them, no grease needed, plus you can taste the food better not fried in all that grease.. this product works for me
Great product! I cooked a Turkey Breast for our Thanksgiving meal in this fryer and it turned out perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to use and clean!!
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to use and even easier to clean. I bought one for my daughter ghetto and she loves hers as well. It’s also great for reheating and crisping up fried foods. We love the sleek look!!

Absolutely wonderful.. wished I had bought it sooner!! Excellent product would recommend it to anyone.. just made an upside down pineapple cake and it was perfect .. made cupcakes also. My grandchildren love it.

I have only had this a short while but loving it so far. My husband loves making tater tots in it and also I reheated leftover take out pizza and it tasted like it was just delivered. Can not wait to keep learning more recipes with this.
Great product. It stopped working, wrote for warranty and they sent me another one.
Great product. It was a gift for my mom, but I have since used it as well. It has a large capacity and everything we have made tastes great! I would highly recommend. Thank you!

reviews.reviewTitle: Received what looks like a refurbished air frier instead of a new one.
reviews.reviewText: Received the item today and it’s going back tomorrow. It looks like a refurbished cooker, with scratches on the body and the screen. It’s does not appear used, but it is most certainly not new.
This is a pretty good product, which it were bigger to cook a whole fryer at once. The best I made so far was coconut shrimp and catfish! Definitely much healthier than oil frying!!

None of my food cooks correctly. I’ve followed the recipe book instructions to the tee and both times I’ve made chicken, it’s been undercooked. I’ve almost had to double the cook time. Donuts also needed another minute or so, but came out perfect.
We've had a couple of fryers, this one I'm very happy with. I love the large size, and the coating of the pan is wearing well. Cooks great, thanks for the great product.
I like this air fryer but don't know many uses for it. It makes great sweet potato fries. I know I'll do better with time.
I bought this for my husband for Christmas. We used it right away and it was awesome. I was very sad though it did not come with the pizza pan.

reviews.reviewTitle: it is great!! Love this product
reviews.reviewText: I use my air fryer daily, it is great!! Love this product.

It’s big but that means I can fit more food!!! I haven’t used it that many times but I have made chicken fingers, banana chips, sweet potato chips and pita chips using Joseph pita. So far I’m loving it!

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it, I cooked chicken
reviews.reviewText: I love it, I cooked chicken, and the french fries, are awesome, the chicken was moist and juicy, but crispy on the outside, very pleased.
I had a very small problem but Michelle persevered and solved it. She could have just shined me on. Thank you!
I have used this air fryer almost every day since I got it. I like it very much.

reviews.reviewTitle: Got this for my mother as an X-Mas present. ...
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my mother as an X-Mas present. Since she has received it she said she hasn't used her stove in months. She LOVES it!

This is the fastest and easiet way to cook hands down..The meats are so juicy...I find that watching YouTube video's is the best way to learn how to use your Air Fryer. You cannot go wrong with this product.
good price, works very well but I have experienced uneven cooking, from middle to edges.

reviews.reviewTitle: This fryer is awesome! I can't believe how delicious and quick it ...
reviews.reviewText: This fryer is awesome! I can't believe how delicious and quick it is to make fried foods with no oil. The only problem with it is the drawer isn't easy to slide open and close, but that would not deter me from buying one.

reviews.reviewTitle: How did I live without this?!
reviews.reviewText: I didn't think I could love a kitchen appliance more than my crock pot. This has changed my mind!! So easy to use, to clean, and the food comes out amazing!! Do yourself a favor and get the biggest one you can find!
I love this air fryer. Very easy to use and food comes out great. Sometimes it doesn't shut off and sometimes it does when I hit the power button, but it hasn't been a big issue. Happy so far!!

reviews.reviewTitle: How can you cook organic food in a horrible chemical smell
reviews.reviewText:
I returned the air fryer. My note to the manufacturer.

I returned your air fryer because the non stick coating inside the air fryer and inside each piece of the air fryer smelled with a horrible overbearing smell of chemicals.

How can you cook organic food in such an environment? You cannot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be sure a get the warrenty.
reviews.reviewText: I love my air fryer. Only thing that happened was that the coil inside cracked after a few weeks after I got it. But Simple Living replaced it with no problem Michelle was very helpful in customer servi.ce.
Great air fryer. No complaints. Easy to use. Food cooks well, crispy and quick.
Cooks nicely and operation is easy. One problem is that it is sometimes difficult to separate the handle from the pan.
Love this Air Fryer. So much better way of preparing food in a healthy manner. Hubby loves his french fries.

reviews.reviewTitle: fantastic. like a microwave only crispy!
reviews.reviewText: fantastic. like a microwave only crispy!

Amazing
Had it about a month now. Have used it about 10 times. So far I love it!!! There is a bit of a learning curve but i am really liking it.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little of a berthing ease cleaning etc.
reviews.reviewText: I like everything about this product huge easy to use great customer service. Had a good feeling ordering this fryer so glad I did.
I love this product.
I'm so in love with this product. I have been cooking non-stop since I received it. I was skeptical at first and now I can't stop cooking with this thing. Buy one today you won't regret it.
For someone who doesn’t cook, I certainly use this air fryer a lot.

Michelle loves it.

I have made homemade French fries, salt and pepper chicken wings and shrimp tempura since I got the air fryer. The chicken wings and shrimps are perfect. I love this air fryer so far, and I will try to make Chinese roast pork next.
Very happy with the air fryer, would
This air-fryer has not only simplified my work in the kitchen but is helping me to eat healthier. I like it very much and bought two more for my children.
awesome

Bought in August of 2017 stoped heating in December of 2018 made it to the garbage can, bought another brand.
We absolutely love this product, it's performance, easy to clean, and the fryer cooks up great tasting food!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to a busy day.
reviews.reviewText: We have found it to be a healthy addition to our kitchen. You can fry without little or no oil. I use an olive oil mist on the fish and you can actually hear the crunch. The basket fits into the dishwasher making clean up a breeze.
Epic tool. No preheating, no grease, but still tasty.
IF YOU BUY THIS BE SURE TO GET REPLACEMENT INSURANCE. STOPS WORKING AFTER 1 YR.

Went all out for this on Prime Day, on Tuesday. AND, it's not worth the hype. Do not think we'll keep it. Opened to find the "coated" interior is NOT what we use. (We're a stainless steel or cast iron cooking family) This is coated with that stuff you can scratch off. YIKES!!!! That, folks, is NOT healthy! Because it can kill our birds, we had to use it outside with a GFI outlet. That is not going to work during the winter months at all. The Best Buy.

Cons:

Many air fryer recipes are in Celsius 180 C is about 375 F

I grew up cooking with cast iron skillets. Its how I was taught to cook. So anything fried was done in cast iron. I'm a die hard when it comes to frying with Crisco in my pans. They heat evenly and make for the best fried....well just about anything. Recently I had weight loss surgery. This meant no more fried foods for me. I love the taste and crunch but my body wasn't allowed the grease. When I heard about air fryers I was pretty excited to try one. I wanted to see if I could truly get the same taste from a air fryer. One of my first concerns was finding one that was large enough to feed my entire family. It is my husband and myself and our 5 children. I didn't want anything that I had to make two off because the basket wasn't large enough. This Simple Living air fryer is amazingly large. I love the digital read out. It's really easy to understand. It came wish a cook book with recipes but honestly I went straight to google. My first meal was chicken legs. I made and amazing recipe I found online. I was able to fit 20 small legs in the basket and probably could have fit more. They came out amazingly crispy and tasted amazing. The best part no Crisco! This cleans really easily and I love all the extra baskets. The cook time is cut in half making it a great option when youre running late. Even better when youre in mid summer and it's 90+ outside using an air fryer means you don't have to turn on your stove. I am looking forward to frying a chicken. yes, a whole chicken! That's next on the list. If youre trying to eat healthier this is a great option.

I have been thinking about getting an air fryer for some time now but wasn't sure it would be worth the purchase. Then my neighbor bought one and I watched her easily make scrumptious wings. She got the one at Costco that is about $100 cheaper and I was tempted to get that one but, after researching several, decided to try this one because I wanted the bigger basket so we could make chicken, fish fillets, etc.
So far, we have made cornesh game hens, wings, zucchini fries and a bloomin' onion. All came out great. I just purchased some fish fillets and other stuff to try. This is a sleek unit, for the size, and is very easy to clean! We are very happy with our purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: This fryer will cook just about anything!
reviews.reviewText: I used to eat deep fried foods all the time, like, daily. Eventually, I fell out of love with doing so, 20 minutes to preheat the fryer, standing over it to keep an eye on the food, replacing a gallon of oil every month or two. So, I mostly stopped eating fries, onion rings, mozarella sticks, and the like for years. I had always wanted an air fryer, but it was never in the front of my mind. I saw an air fryer while walking through a store one morning, and then went home and started researching what were the best, and what would suit my needs. I wanted something big, for making entire bowls of fries for myself and friends. I ended up buying this model, and I LOVE it. I use it several times a week, and it will cook just about anything you throw at it. It has produced some of the best frozen fries I have ever made. It produces near perfect mozarella sticks. I use it to reheat and slightly crisp McDonald’s fries when I get home with them, as well as McNuggets. I have cooked hamburgers in it, which came out great. My only complaint would be that it doesn’t do well with fresh cut fries, and I would be willing to bet there is simply something I am doing wrong. Also, cleaning it is super easy, and takes about two minutes, whereas a deep fryer could take me an hour to clean. I have found that this replaces many of the functions of my oven, toaster over, and deep fryer. Well worth the purchase.

I was a little unsure as to how useful this air fryer would be, but it is GREAT! We have only had it 3 wks, but everything we have tried in it so far has turned out amazingly well. We've tried crispy potatoes, zucchini and french fries, breaded chicken and battered frozen fish. Big surprise was frozen biscuits, turned out great in only 10 minutes and no heating up the oven. This product will only increase in value during the summer by avoiding the oven heating. Customer service is great; they even followed up to make sure we liked the product. So far, cleanup has been very easy.

This is the first air fryer I bought so have nothing to compare it to, but it has worked wonderfully for me. It cooks but keeps the food moist. I think timing is the key and it takes time to see how different things cook. I like that I can open and check and adjust if I need to. I am still learning.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it. I can have French Fries cooked in ...
reviews.reviewText:
I love it. I can have French Fries cooked in 10 min for my grandson, he loves French fries.
The fries are a lot healthier for him cooked in the air fryer, so I do not feel bad about making him fries.
I bought the big one for family use and I am still experimenting on cooking different things.
So far it has cooked everything I have tried really good.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the size of this thing!!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this air fryer. I have been looking for an upgrade to a small one that I have and this is absolutely perfect. I was able to cook 10-12 chicken tenders at one time. I love the digital features as well. I would definitely recommend this air fryer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product. The first one we got

As it was still under warranty, the company happily sent me a replacement quickly, with no hassle of issues. Very happy with the new one, and for dealing with an honest company. I would recommend to friends and family.
This product is a solid performer. I air-fried sweet potatoes and they turned out nicely done and crisp. Can't ask for anything more. I look forward to trying several other foods in this appliance.

I debated over whether to buy a smaller unit or go for this larger size. I'm glad a opted for this wonderful fryer because the extra room enhances the air circulation. It looks good and cooks good. Go for it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely recommend this for cooking for more than two people
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer was purchased for a gift, but I had the opportunity to use it while visiting the recipient. It is larger than the one I have at home, a bit more quiet, cooks evenly, and comes with more accessories. Definitely recommend this for cooking for more than two people.

My first air fryer and it gets good use. Only issue I have is the basket coating has come off in spots. I have only hand washed it so not sure of the issue with that. I suggest you get the basket covers to avoid this problem. Makes food nice and crispy. A great companion to my instant pot.
I can’t believe how easy this to use d anything I cook in it comes out so juicy, moist and good.

Excellent product for the money! We use it all the time, for french fries, for onion rings, to rehat pizza, roast veggies, potato chips - you name it! Very versatile product - I could not live without it! Since we are no oil vegans, this product is a godsend!
The frying basket has a nice capacity as well!
Received this as a gift and I absolutely love it! Use almost daily as there really isn’t anything you can’t cook in this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely the best investment I have made
reviews.reviewText: Definitely the best investment I have made. It is amazing and have zero issues with it. It has made my cooking life a little easier when it comes to making snacks/lunch for my son. Everything taste 10x better from using this.
Works very well and so easy! I use it almost every night. This is my best kitchen purchase in a very long time. Good size for my family of 4.
This air fryer is super easy to use and my food always turns out delicious. I will say the customer service from at Simple Living was exceptional.
Easy to use and stand behind their product.

qAndA.question: Can you fry a whole Turkey in this, if so how big of a Turkey ?
qAndA.answer: Would have to be a really small turkey, if you’re cooking a whole one. You can cook a whole chicken.

qAndA.question: Why is the price all of a sudden $100 more expensive?
qAndA.answer: Make sure you are not looking at an unauthorized seller. Simple Living Products do not adjust their prices.

qAndA.question: Can it fry bacon
qAndA.answer: I have not but if you check the cook book or the the manufacturer would give you the answer.

qAndA.question: Can you cook without the basket just in the large pan? Is it an issue scratching the bottom of the pan when taking the basket in and out?
qAndA.answer: Yes, you can cook in the pan without the basket. Just dont use metal utensils and there shouldn't be any issues.

qAndA.question: With this being a large air fryer, can I also use it for only 2 people? Will there be recipes for smaller potions with the fryer?
qAndA.answer: It is just my husband and I and we use this all the time. As for recipes I just cut ingredients in half. You can also purchase a divider to keep your foods seperate. Just last night I made meatballs and i just googled how long to cook them and at what temperature. We love our air fryer :)

qAndA.question: This is 220v
Do you need to use liners? I've seen them sold separately.
qAndA.answer: Have never used a liner nor have I seen any.

qAndA.question: Had anyone experienced signs of peeling?
qAndA.answer: I've used for 6 months - no peeling or flaking.

qAndA.question: How large a turkey can be cooked ?
qAndA.answer: Maybe 10 lb

qAndA.question: Can i buy a replacement basket?
qAndA.answer: My basket cracked by the handle. When I contacted Simple Living they sent a new one as it was still under warranty. I would contact their customer service as they were extremely helpful

qAndA.question: Several reviews comment on the teflon coating flaking off even with special and proper washing. Has anyone that purchased recently had the same prob?
qAndA.answer: It was a gift but I will ask when I see the person this week.

qAndA.question: Does this Air Fryer come with a cooking divider?
qAndA.answer: just received mine yesterday and it did NOT come with a divider. I saw one answer that said it did and was wondering if anyone else got a divider with theirs.

qAndA.question: Can you pull the divided basket out and add food in the middle of cooking? In case I have two items that need different times?
qAndA.answer: Yes! You can always take the basket out and even mixed it turns of

qAndA.question: How to find an online Manuel for this fryer?
qAndA.answer: Hi Joe, if you email us the manufacturer we can email you on. You can message us here on Amazon or email us directly at "sales@simplelivingproducts.com". Thanks.

qAndA.question: Does it smoke when cooking?
qAndA.answer:
As long as you do not add oil or leave too much fat/oil (like from dripping bacon) it should not smoke. Be sure and place it several inches away from the wall. Hope that helps!
Kelly
Ifyouhaveanegg.com

qAndA.question: Can you only cook things, such as chicken wings, in a single layer?
qAndA.answer: No. I use mine for everything. I just open it up if I have more than a single layer. Flip things and it starts right uo.

qAndA.question: Does this have a timer and auto shut off?
qAndA.answer: Yes it has both.

qAndA.question: Can you only cook chicken wings, in a single layer? I would love to cook a batch of wings for 2-3 people at once.
qAndA.answer: You could do more, you just have to take them out and shake them like you would for French fries

qAndA.question: Whats the actual size of the air fryers?
qAndA.answer: 5.8QT

qAndA.question: where is the preset mode button?
qAndA.answer: push the "M" on the air fryer face and options appear. Keep pressing "M" until you see the type of food you are trying to cook (Fries, shrimp, chicken, etc."

qAndA.question: can you toast bread or bagels?
qAndA.answer: I have never tried to toast bread or bagels. If you contact Simple Living, they have great customer service to answer and assist with questions, recipes.

qAndA.question: Will crispy Pata just as good as in oil?
qAndA.answer: Yes it will.

qAndA.answer: I cannot answer your question at the moment since we are still experimenting with all the cooking options..
